pull.title: Remove unused "What's This" button in dialogs on Windows OS
pull.body:
Fix #74.

From [Qt docs](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qdialog.html#QDialog):
> The widget flags _f_ are passed on to the `QWidget` constructor. If, for example, you don't want a **What's This** button in the title bar of the dialog, pass `Qt::WindowTitleHint | Qt::WindowSystemMenuHint` in _f_.

Screenshot on Windows 10 (2004):
- master (3ba25e3bdde3464eed5d2743d68546e48b005544)
![Screenshot from 2020-09-07 16-55-42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/92402384-20dc6a00-f138-11ea-9dcb-3e0f6373ff22.png)

- this PR (e322fe7e19ac504272d14b9b4f9b28b13df888ed)
![Screenshot from 2020-09-07 18-31-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/92402509-5aad7080-f138-11ea-8b63-9bbbf8b9b9e1.png)

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

events.body: Please split this into two commits, otherwise literally every commit could be a scripted diff by including the diff as a patch in the commit body

tree 304b405cc792076305dde4a12c2e8862a9ccf607
parent 3ba25e3bdde3464eed5d2743d68546e48b005544
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1599494895 +0300

qt: Add flags to prevent a "What's This" button on Windows OS

events.message: qt: Add flags to prevent a "What's This" button on Windows OS

verification.payload:
tree 9161e1373e2bb7eeb0643a121a05411d472ed080
parent b6951483ecdd4409a0e1d492c93bcd4d823f039d
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1599494973 +0300
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1599494973 +0300

scripted-diff: Remove unused "What's This" button in dialogs on Windows

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
git grep -l 'QDialog(parent)' -- src/qt | xargs sed -i -E 's/QDialog\(parent\)/QDialog\(parent, GUIUtil::dialog_flags\)/g'
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.body:
Updated e322fe7e19ac504272d14b9b4f9b28b13df888ed -> ac7ccd67d7f2b09e36dd57405f899e4698dd3d78 ([pr85.01](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr85.01) -> [pr85.02](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr85.02), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/compare/pr85.01..pr85.02)):
- addressed @MarcoFalke's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/85#issuecomment-688407464):
> Please split this into two commits, otherwise literally every commit could be a scripted diff by including the diff as a patch in the commit body

tACK ac7ccd67d7f2b09e36dd57405f899e4698dd3d78 Tested on Windows 10.0.18363 Build 18363. 

Master ([`56a461f`](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/commit/9af7c1993b3512a7230f723b1923abd496989c59)) vs this PR ([`ac7ccd6`](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/commit/ac7ccd67d7f2b09e36dd57405f899e4698dd3d78))

![Group 109](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55287964/96964493-1e45a080-153d-11eb-9dec-6458dee8a842.png)

This PR also removes this unused dialog button from the following windows on Windows 10 compared to master. 

- About Bitcoin Core
- Command-line options
- Request payment modal when generating a new receive address
- Create Wallet
- Encrypt wallet when creating a new wallet
- Signature signing / verifying 
- Open Bitcoin URI 
- Receive addresses 
- Sending addresses
Is there a way we can exclude the "What's This?" button rather than explicitly list included buttons?

> Is there a way we can exclude the "What's This?" button rather than explicitly list included buttons?

Qt docs do not provide that way.

Code review ACK ac7ccd67d7f2b09e36dd57405f899e4698dd3d78 but with some suggestions.

Does it make sense to have a `QDialog` subclass? There's also the call `handleCloseWindowShortcut`.

@luke-jr 
> Is there a way we can exclude the "What's This?" button rather than explicitly list included buttons?

I was [wrong](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/85#issuecomment-716048754).

The `Qt::AA_DisableWindowContextHelpButton` application attribute value was added in Qt 5.10.

Unfortunately, we have minimum Qt version 5.5.1.

comments.body: It extends dialog but it's not used as such. I think you could drop this change?

> I think you could drop this change?

Adding widget flags to remove "What's This" button is the goal of this PR. Or did I understand you in a wrong way?
